section.p: The following steps must be performed manually to enable access to the monitoring functionality in OpenStack Horizon:

li.p: Edit your local_settings.py file. The file is located in your plugin installation directory <monasca_ui_dir>/lib/python2.7/site-packages/ monitoring/config/.
Define a group name for log paths in the file. The group name is required to display irregularities in your log data on the Overview page in OpenStack Horizon.
Add the following line to the MONITORING_SERVICES_GROUPS parameter in the Service group names section:
Replace <region> by the name of your OpenStack region for the GRAFANA_URL parameter, for example RegionOne.
Set the ENABLE_KIBANA_BUTTON to True. By default, it is set to False.
Replace <kibana_host> by the IP address of the node for the KIBANA_HOST parameter. Example URL: http://192.168.10.6:5601/.
To handle HTTP proxy requests, the mod_proxy and mod_proxy_http modules must be enabled in Apache. Check whether they are already enabled:

The modules are enabled if the command output includes proxy_module and proxy_http_module. If not, add the following lines to the httpd.conf file. The file is located in the /etc/httpd/conf/ directory.
li.codeblock: LoadModule proxy_module modules/mod_proxy.so LoadModule proxy_http_module modules/mod_proxy_http.so

li.p: Configure a proxy path pointing to your Grafana instance for the VHost that hosts your OpenStack Horizon instance.
Add the following lines to the <VirtualHost *:80> element in the 15-horizon_vhost.conf file. The file is located in the /etc/httpd/conf.d/ directory.
Replace <grafana_host> by the IP address of the node. Example URL: http://192.168.10.6:3000.
To integrate the Monitoring Service with the OpenStack Horizon service, create links pointing to the Horizon Plugin.
Example with /opt/monasca-ui/ as plugin installation directory:
Append the virtual env libraries of the Horizon Plugin to the system path of the OpenStack Horizon service. For this purpose, two files must be edited.

Append the path where the plugin is installed to the django.wsgi file. The WSGI script of your OpenStack platform is located in the /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/ openstack_dashboard/wsgi/ directory.
Example of django.wsgi file with /opt/monasca-ui/ as plugin installation directory:
li.codeblock:
import logging import os import sys sys.path.append("/opt/monasca-ui/lib/python2.7/site-packages") from django.core.wsgi import get_wsgi_application from django.conf import settings
# Add this file path to sys.path in order to import settings sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), '../..')) os.environ['DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'] = 'openstack_dashboard.settings' sys.stdout = sys.stderr
DEBUG = False
application = get_wsgi_application()
li.p: Append the path where the plugin is installed to the manage.py file. The manage.py file is located in the /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/ directory.
